answers.answer: Are your thyroid levels under control and optimal? This will make a huge difference in your glucose levels.Both are part of your endocrine system and I would imagine will affect each other, especially if untreated.Glad to see that they listened to you finally! :)

question: Now a dx of Diabetic Type II has been made based on a 3-hour Glucose Tolerance Test.  Told that Dr a year ago there was more going on that merely Thyroid and Perimenopause.  Was I ever right!Turns out that in an overview of regular blood tests, I don't indicate any problem.  Fasting blood glucose is still in the Normal range despite it takes 3 hours on the GTT for my glucose to get back to a normal level.So curiously, what considerations are involved with Hypothyroid and Diabetes?Thanks!
title: Adding Conditions
